metadata.title: CVE-2023-31083 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/bluetooth/hci_ldisc.c in the Linuxkernel 6.2. In hci_uart_tty_ioctl, there is a race condition betweenHCIUARTSETPROTO and HCIUARTGETPROTO. HCI_UART_PROTO_SET is set beforehu->proto is set. A NULL pointer dereference may occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-88-generic - 5.15.0-88.98
linux-image-5.15.0-88-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-88.98
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-88-generic - 5.15.0-88.98
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-88-generic-64k - 5.15.0-88.98
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1046-kvm - 5.15.0-1046.51
No subscription required
